Plot forecast or hindcast predictions for a given point in time across multiple species.

Source: R/figures.R
plot_cast_point.Rd

Plot the point value with confidence interval for a step in a forecast or hindcast across multiple species. Currently only reliable for forecasts.

plot_cast_point(tree = dirtree(), species = NULL, level = "Controls",
  cast_type = "forecasts", cast_date = NULL, model = "Ensemble",
  lead = 1, from_date = NULL, with_census = FALSE)

Arguments

tree

dirtree-class directory tree list. See dirtree.
species

character vector of the species codes (or "total" for the total across species) to be plotted or NULL (default) to plot all species and the total.
level

character value of the level of interest ("All" or "Controls").
cast_type

character value of the type of -cast of model. Used to select the file in the predictions subdirectory. Currently only reliably coded for "forecasts".
cast_date

Date the predictions were made. Used to select the file in the predictions subdirectory. If NULL (default), selects the most recent -casts (if with_census = FALSE) or the most recent -casts with a subsequent census (if with_census = TRUE).
model

character value of the name (or "Ensemble") of the model to be plotted.
lead

integer-conformable lead of the newmoon number used to select the data plotted.
from_date

Date to be used as a reference of when to count the lead from. If NULL (default), for cast_type = "forecasts", from_date = cast_date and plot_cast_point is not yet reliable for cast_type = "hindcasts".
with_census

logical toggle if the plot should include the observed data collected during the predicted census.

Examples

# NOT RUN {
setup_dir(all_options(download_existing_predictions = TRUE))
plot_cast_point()
plot_cast_point(with_census = TRUE)
# }
